content.description: Hand crack on the left side of a whaleback shaped formation. Slightly bouldery start at the bottom, rolls over to easy walk up with pro placements up a flat area. Descent is to downclimb this crack or the one next door.
content.protection: Bottom section up to C4 #3, top area can take large cams for anchor
content.location: NW across a gully from the road that ends in the Cattle Pocket. NW from Cattle Pocket area.

content.description: The Crux move is moving from under the roof up into the chimney. Make a few hand jams in the crack to gain footing on the face as you move up and left into the chimney. From there it is a good face climb but if needed at the bottom you can do some chimney moves.  Keep an eye out for some great side pulls on the face of the front wall.
content.protection: Seven Bolts with two open cold shuts on top.
content.location: The start is in the crack under the roof to the right. There hooks on top of the route but before you Rap off you might want to consider setting a Top rope on the same anchor for the Face route  Chardoney Champagne 5.9 just to the right.

content.description: Start atop the boulder and easily clip first bolt- Fun gritty slab climbing gives way to shallow dishes and edges up the center of the slab, through the obvious weaknesses.
content.location: Center of the very pretty and blank looking far right end of the Cattle Pocket Wall. Blitzos photo shows "Curving Crack" To the left of this climb. Blank Looking bolted face to the right.

climbs.name: Pop
climbs.fa: Sean Courage, Michael Strassman, Jackie Carroll.

content.description: This is on the left side of the second tower, facing north. A difficult entry leads to easier climbing. 9 bolts.

Right side of the blank far end wall. Rubber tester start off the deck leads to even more invisible feet and imaginary hands. Described as "Open Project" in the 2008 guide. Locals say the new name is "Mustafa" Extremely delicate movements may gain the middle/upper section where climbing gets a bit easier with actual handholds.
content.protection: 5 bolts and 2 Hangers for anchors. No chains or hooks
content.location: Right hand side of the striking blank face that is described in 2008 Guide as " Cattle Pocket- Far Right"

content.description: This climbs the last tower before the slab.
Top rope the thin cracks to the left of "Birthday Butt Crack".
Goes up the dihedral to a crack.
content.location: Dihedral just left around the corner from Itty Bitty Tittie Committee.

content.description: Climbs the face on decent holds. Crux is the first bit.
content.location: Climbs the face above the boulders to the left of Birthday Butt Crack

content.description:
This climbs scary holds on the right side if the second tower. To the right of "Pop".

Climb past 9 bolts to the anchor.

More hard than fun.  Tricky pro is barely adequate to keep you off the ground.  Better be solid at the grade before jumping on this one.  After the initial dihedral, it becomes more of a face climb than a crack as the name would imply.
content.protection: A few cams to 1.5" and then three 5/16" button head bolts (hard to see).
content.location: Far right side of the Cattle Pocket.  Starts in an obvious dihedral, then follows the seam up and right.  Shares the last bolt and anchor of 5.10b "Slab"

climbs.name: Choss Moss and Butt Floss
climbs.fa: M. Strassman, C. Byrne, J. Carroll.

content.description: Climb the bolted crack right of "Birthday Butt Crack", past 7 bolts to a two bolt anchor.

climbs.name: Choss Factor 10
climbs.fa: unknown and I made up the name.  Claim it and I'll change it.

content.description: Start with a blind bolt clip on the rounded chossy flare.  Work your way up into the super grotty chimney or do a few bold face moves up the arete.  Either way a fall will probably knock you silly.  Clip another bolt which seems to be after the crux (not good for your longevity) and then wander up the face and grainy cracks to the top.  If you have pro, place it.  If you do not, well, carry on and keep your wits about you.
content.protection: 3 bolts on the route and up high you could lob in a cam or two in the 1" to 2" range.
content.location: Starts just left of Magic Pig with a blind-ish bolt clip out on what could be called an arete.  Mussy Hooks at the top.

content.description: The Crux move is getting over the Roof at the start and getting on to the Face for a good mix of 5.8 to 5.9 climbing. This is a good pumpy steep route with an abundance of good underclings and sidepulls but care must be taken as the rock is a little weak and pulling off a hold would certainly be a possibility but worth the fun factor. Belayer should be sure to wear a helmet.
content.protection: Lead climb "The Split 5.9" in the chimney just to the left of this climb and use the anchor on top of it to Top Rope this route giving you two routes to choose from.
content.location: This Route is Located on the face just right of "The Split" Look for the Crack on the Cattle Pocket main Wall. The Start is right above the ground floor roof.

content.description: Prominent highest crack system on "The Cattle Hole." Begins on top of a boulder in a dihedral on the left front side of Cattle Hole. Climbs the hand crack with good pro until it flares into an offwidth with little pro to the ledge. Belay from large ledge under chockstone. Follow dihedral crack between The two main features of Cattle hole up to bolted anchor on the right face as the crack begins to flare into an offwidth. Rappel from this anchor to the right all the way to the ground with a 70 meter rope.
content.location: North east corner of Cattle Hole.

climbs.name: Blackhawk Pinnacle
climbs.fa: Mike Strassman, Byron Barry, Ralph Soule

content.description: Climbs a seam to a ledge, finish on face.  Lower off.
content.location: Located on the prominent tower to the left of Jackie's Rack.

climbs.name: Birthday Butt Crack
climbs.fa: M. Strassman, J. Carroll, C. Byrne.

content.description:
This is on the first tower, behind Tuning in Tokyo Tower.

It faces east.

Climb the left, hand crack to a fixed anchor.
content.location: This is the first tower behind Tuning in Tokyo Tower. The climbs are a short scramble from the road.
